content.question: A wire has a length of <math alttext="0.5 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>, a circular cross section of radius <math alttext="2 times 10 to the negative 4 power, meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>, and a resistance of <math alttext="2.5 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>. What is the resistivity of the material used to make the wire?

choices.label: <math alttext="6 times 10 to the negative 7 power, ohm meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1 times 10 to the negative 3 power, ohm meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="6 times 10 to the third power, ohm meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1 times 10 to the seventh power, ohm meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>7</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="6 times 10 to the negative 7 power, ohm meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
